metadata.name: Configure Fapolicy Module to Employ a Deny-all, Permit-by-exception Policy to Allow the Execution of Authorized Software Programs.
metadata.description: The Fapolicy module must be configured to employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs and to prevent unauthorized software from running.
metadata.rationale:
Utilizing a whitelist provides a configuration management method for allowing the execution of only authorized software.
Using only authorized software decreases risk by limiting the number of potential vulnerabilities. Verification of whitelisted software occurs prior to execution or at system startup.

Proceed with caution with enforcing the use of this daemon.
Improper configuration may render the system non-functional.
The "fapolicyd" API is not namespace aware and can cause issues when launching or running containers.

manual_remediation: The Fapolicy module must be configured to employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs and to prevent unauthorized software from running.
